info.papyri.dispatch.browse.facet

Class IdentifierFacet

  • java.lang.Object
    • info.papyri.dispatch.browse.facet.Facet
      • info.papyri.dispatch.browse.facet.IdentifierFacet

  • public class IdentifierFacet
extends Facet
    Facet for selecting texts based on DDbDP/HGV series, APIS collection, volume, and id number. Note the following ruies for navigation in this fashion: (1) Navigation may be performed EITHER through APIS collection OR DDbDP/HGV series - the two are mutually exclusive (2) DDbDP/HGV series may have volume numbers; APIS collections never do (3) DDbDP identifiers for individual items are defined in the ddbdp_full_identifier field (4) HGV identifiers for individual items are defined in the hgv_full_identifier field (5) APIS identifiers for individual items are defined in apis_full_identifier, apis_ publication_id, and apis_inventory_number fields Note also that most of the heavy lifting for this class is performed in the inner SearchConfiguration classes defined at the end of the file. Note further the idiosyncratic use of the terms collection and series here. In other classes, collection is usually used to refer to the top level of the classification hierarchy (i.e., collection -> series -> idno). Here, however, a distinction must be drawn between the top level of the apis hierarchy, and the top level of the ddbdp/hgv hierarchy. Collection in this class thus refers to the top of the apis hierachy, while series is used for ddbdp/hgv hierarchies.
    Author:
    thill
    See Also:
    Facet, info.papyri.dispatch.browse.facet.SearchConfiguration

      • getFormNames

        public String[] getFormNames()
        Description copied from class: Facet
        Returns the value(s) to be used for the name attribute on HTML form controls. In most cases only one value is required, and will be tat of the formName member. However, some facets have more than one HTML control - hence the need for this method to return an array of Strings, rather than a String.
        Overrides:
        getFormNames in class Facet
        Returns:
